intro: [WRONG START] Rosa canina semidupplex, commonly known as the semi-double dog rose, is a cultivar of the Rosa canina species. It is characterized by its semi-double bloom, featuring a central cluster of petals surrounded by a ring of smaller, petal-like structures. The plant produces fragrant, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is dark green and glossy, with thorny stems typical of the Rosa genus. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in perfumery and herbal medicine.
